oZpJpbiO0UyMkcc2UThHKg.text: We arrived at Baileys around 5:45pm on a Tuesday and it was already packed! We waited for a few people to pick up their take-away order, and we were able to sit at the counter facing out to the window. We ordered a medium size cod, large size cod to share, large chips, green salad, and coleslaw. The green salad was beautifully arranged and it tasted great. The fish fresh, hot, and the batter stayed crispy. My husband really liked the coleslaw - probably the best he's had. It wasn't too watery and they make it fresh there. The service was great as well. My husband ended up getting the pineapple and apple fritters as well. Such a great meal at a reasonable price. Total for the 3 of us was £18.55.

FqurGIHP5gg6BKPqYS8-Mg.text: Took the advice from another website and it took nearly a $30 cab ride for a $8 fish and chips. It was worth every penny. Note they do not sell beer. Not that kind of a place. And they have maybe 12 wall seats BUT this place is special. The fried fish was amazing and the cole slow was tart and delicious. Being American the chips weren't to my liking but I think that's more of a cultural thing than quality. Portions were very ample at the medium. A must go if you have time.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

IkKpJPmdc6CqZWw0jfYFzg.text: This has got to be the BEST fish and chips in London. Even those top 5 fish and chips that pops up in google can't beat this. Such a hidden gem!! So glad it's found in my neighbourhood! Oh and the service is excellent too!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Best Fish and Chips in London!

zWi-eA9pfR-VtNlIoTpyHQ.text: Wow! This is how you do fish and chips! I was not too keen when my boyfriend told me we had to take the car to get awesome fish and chips. It was cold, dark and I thought I was better with my blanket and telly than venturing out. How wrong I was!We arrived there on Saturday evening and there were 4 lovely employees (I guess some of them were the owners as well) in really good mood and looking efficient.  They have a quite extense menu for a take away and I saw plenty of things I want to try next time: scampi, calamari, cod, plaice, haddock, chicken... I think you get an idea.The place was quite busy with what seemed, regular customers. I know that because the guy taking the orders was chatting to them like if they were friends. There are three little tables, but not the perfect place to have a relaxed dinner. Altough the touch of the flowers helps! We have to wait for our food for around 5 minutes and the food boxes weren't closing due to the amount of  food inside. The pieces of fish are just obscene. And the chips? I even regret asking for them, I was so full with half a fish burger that I could not eat more than a couple of them. But yes, they were delicious and the bag was massive.I was quite surprised to see they also have organic ice creams.I would come back for sure although it is not on my way at all. There should be more service like that all around the world, they are so nice!!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Scampi and chips
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Half of a portion
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Look, flowers!

Uo-5BgoFN5DXLcTZFMMZHA.text: The other reviews say it all - friendly owners and staff and fantastic fish and chips. When we travelled in Great Britain we ate at at least 7 fish and chip places in Wales, Scotland and England and this one beat them all. What else could you ask for? Indeed I will be going here every time I go to London. It's especially good but crowded before or after a Chelsea game. The shop is on a residential street and the sign is on the discreet side so it doesn't jump out at you but it's worth the search. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Eat here!
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Friendly staff with delicious fish in hand.

9WlDGdMWCmb6QDAKbBwGpg.text: Bottom Line: This is the best of London: Jovial staff, an intimate and relaxed atmosphere and hearty portions of the freshest fish and chips served up at a great price.The Food:The food served up at this hole in the wall is classically British: fried fish (haddock, cod), chips, meat pies along with other fried foods such as calamari and scampi. Dishes are simple and the restaurant focuses on delivering big portions at a reasonable price. The quality of the food is outstanding: the fish is piping hot and flaky but not greasy. Flavors are balanced and fresh - the fish fell apart in my mouth but did not taste fishy or overly fried. This carries over to the restaurant's other offerings - I am not a fan of calamari but the calamari served up by Bailey's was so good I'd order another in the future. The Atmosphere:Bailey's is a tiny restaurant with perhaps about 20 counter seats. This gives it an intimate feel and lends to the restaurant's authenticity as one of those holes in the wall that is a neighborhood secret. Staff at this family owned restaurant heartily welcome and tease visitors. At times, you feel like you're over at someone's home for a fish fry than you are at a restaurant. My mom and I visited after completing a long flight from Los Angeles for her first visit to London and the staff dazzled and delighted both of us. The Service:Service is laidback and is handled in a somewhat haphazard way. But this only adds to the place's charm. Multiple staff members waited on us and occasionally forgot what we had ordered. However, I would liken this more to being hosted at a friend's house and having his/her mom, dad, uncles and aunts wait on us rather than feeling like the staff was in over their heads. They were also incredibly gracious. After I declined to try the calamari and scampi, one of the owners was so excited we made his restaurant the first we visited in London, that he offered it us on the house. The restaurant also closes at 10:30 but we saw the owners let a bunch of people in up to 30 minutes after when they came knocking because they wanted to be accommodating.Location:Bailey's is in a residential area in Kensington. It's easily missed but highly worth the trip.Other Details:The restaurant takes cash and credit cards (not Amex). It could also easily get crowded - we were there at 10:15 but could see this place being filled for most of its opening hours.

8aCZw5gnRemehSO26M5a_A.text: Oh how I miss London! I had such a wonderful vacation and this little gem added to my fish and chips experience. The fish was super delicious, but the chips were just ok. If you want affordable, yummy, warm food to fill your belly, visit this establishment for sure!

pCMLB1komBXHHFI3idv8Dg.text: Best fish and chips in London. Small and simple. Great service. Large portions. Affordable.  If you're looking for a good authentic chippy, this is the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. The menu.
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

0tTduUgOOR9z44B4ryk82g.text: Absolutely the best fish and chips ! Everything is cooked fresh and the operations are huge!

bhH6FTNFXg7bx8OtrpeSlA.text: Great experience! My wife and kids had just arrived from the US and we looked up someplace to eat. Baileys came up with high reviews and we were not disappointed. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger, my wife the fish & chips, and my kids got the chicken nuggets. All of it was yummy and the best compliment was my 12 year old daughter saying she wants to move here as those were the best chicken nuggets she ever had. All of the staff were extremely and welcoming to us. I highly recommend you give it a try.

rKc71Nb-FglrDA0URLHiJA.text: If you want excellent fish&chips this is the place to go to.  The fish is fried to perfection,  when you cut into the cod it was the right amount of flaky, juicy, tender and fresh. Order the salmon cake - one of my favorites. The tartar sauce that comes with it rounds each morsel!! the fat girl inside of me was very happy with this place!! Best part is that it was only 13 pounds! Big WINBe aware that it is very small!! Be prepared to smell like a fish fry when you are done if you decide to eat there.

d9x-ZzsHA7HjQp3mCAogsQ.text: A generous portion of moist, flaky cod fried in a batter that remained crisp. High turnover so you're guaranteed a fresh fry and non soggy fish and chips. There are a few seats along the walls if you want to eat in. Lovely waitress who was attentive and apologetic for the slight wait. This place is certainly popular with the locals.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Large cod and chips

Ue06ro2OtzifJrUNDZcNow.text: Just spent a week in London, and I love fish and chips.  So, I went to a different chip shop every night.  This was the last one.  If it was the first one I had gone to, I wouldn't have had to go anywhere else!  It was seriously that good.  It was probably the best fish I've ever eaten - cooked to perfection.  On top of that, I went in near closing.  So, they gave me extra chips, and a HUGE piece of cod.  I could barely finish it.The owners are the nicest people I've met in the UK, ever.  There were a few people outside at the bus stop, and the owners popped out and asked them if they'd like some free chips to keep warm!  You can't beat that.  They were happy, funny, and just made the experience fantastic.If you are in London, visitor or local, you NEED to go here.  I will be here the next time I'm in London.  In fact, it will be the first place I go.  Heathrow to Baileys.  IT'S THE BEST!!!

uc7nUbOGCDVcdvRNwkAfHg.text: For me is the best place to eat fried chips because is not like other place's where they give you small chips here they give you big chips!

dM494p23ZMs6O38Vd-Z-HA.text: Delightful find and I never would have found it without Yelp and tripadvisor. I walked from Chelsea to treat myself to fish and chips (+ mushy peas...not my thing but fresh) on bank holiday. Best fish n chips I ever had, especially the fish. So crispy, fresh and tasty...Bailey's is a "nice" hole in the wall not far from Chelsea football stadium. Reminds me of special places like Famous Lunch in my hometown of Troy, New York (USA).

4hfs69DD-4NMD7eP501YTw.text: It took me about 30 min and a few tube changes but it was totally worth it!!! Probably the best fish and chips I've ever had!!!

0A4WAUrYOgGqiTbxi1qoUw.text: We know London is full of restaurants serving Fish and Chips so we decided to use Yelp for positive reviews. Bailey's lived up to the hype.  Mu whole family had Fish (Cod) and Chips and the homemade coleslaw.  The place is tiny but does take reservations so call ahead. Enjoy!

7j8Wza-aEcXKApxtXyi6RA.text: one of the best fish and chips over london ,  i strongly recommended to visit , restaurant staff very friendly .

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. the menu
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. nice food
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. large fish meal

ZbyejFw1ixmqemR1C5GeYA.text: My husband and I had the best Fish and Chips EVER here! It was so good we came back twice on our 4 day stay in London. We visited back in November of 2014. The piece of fish was gigantic, moist on the inside, and perfectly crisped on the outside. The seating is tight, but worth it!! I drool just thinking about this place.

cUAInQz5RxPZcIVXzwDmQg.text: Proper fish and chips from a Yorkshire ex-pat. Huge whale of a fish and tasty crispy chips.

6gEKfnSxVTfjcl5q8lDPYg.text: 3.5 rating. So I rely on Yelp a lot and during my trip to Europe, I used Yelp heavily. This place popped up when I searched "food" in the area I was in. It had a high rating and it was a classic English dish so I figured it was worth a shot to try. I remember reading somewhere that in the UK, the fish and chips is better along the coast outside of London. I wish I had taken that advice more carefully. The fish was cod. I got the lunch special fish and chips which was a good deal. The fish had absolutely no taste to it. All I tasted was the heavy oil it was cooked in. I had to squeeze so much lemon juice on it plus tartar sauce plus the vinegar type sauce on the table to make it taste acceptable. The fries were great, but I'm expecting the whole meal to be good. The portion size for a lunch special was big so that was nice. Service was welcoming. Unfortunately, if I come back I will not get their lunch special again. Something else next time or a different fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Lunch special. Huge fish they give.

mI1q7UTXGXNHkjM3KJqypw.text: Very delicious! I ordered Cod Fish & Chips. One order was enough for two to eat. We sat down and ate there. There are not a lot of seats but there was enough for the people at that time. The seating is bar style. When we walked in the cashier asked if we were eating there or to go; we were told our options of seating and took a seat. The waiter/cashier came and took our order. You pay after you eat. The food was very delicious, hot, and fresh. The fish was services with a wedge of lemon and tardar sauce.

FrwatHrdGqJz6p2diYkq7g.text: Bailey's is a little family owned fish and chip joint with great food, great service, and reasonable prices.  It looks a like a hole in the wall, but is clean new inside, with only counter seating.  The fish and chips, onion rings and other sides are excellent with great service to go along.  The prices are very reasonable.

FrEcznXq2jkwbdQKlM7l3A.text: Being from the US, I've not had fish in chips in London that I can say I really enjoyed.  Bailey's was ready great and the fish tasted fresh and flavorful.  The staff (could be the owner?) was personable and assisted with a smile.  5 thumbs up from my viewpoint and experience.

7EVIUSRS4tbRyeXTu7OcXA.text: As other reviewers have said, Bailey's is worth leaving your neighborhood.   They serve HUGE portions of delicious fish (we had Cod and Haddock) and delicious chips, are very affordable, and are so very friendly.  I really wanted to have fish and chips somewhere other than an overpriced pub chain, and this was the place.   A bonus was taking a short stroll through Fulham, quite a nice neighborhood.  The only thing that would have made me happier is if the food was served in newspaper, but I don't think that is legal anymore!

7clyWCsPQwE2B2xpgf2k0g.text: I'm from London and am visiting with a friend from the US. We are staying in the Chelsea area of London, an area I had never ventured into until this visit. Used Yelp to find a fish n chip shop. This was the closest to our hotel. Fish and chips are cooked to order, served piping hot. We ordered two medium meals and I had pickled onions with mine. Chips are crisp, fish is crisp on the outside and bland. Think they are missing something in the batter. I doused my chips and fish with vinegar and yet couldn't taste the tang of vinegar. My suspicion is the vinegar was watered down. Going back to my part of town for some REAL fish n chips in the East End. Filling for what it's worth. Pickled onions were delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Fish n chips with a pickled onion. Cod.

WC6N0oV1jGa44RrfvuY7MA.text: This place has the most amazing fish and chips I've tried during my trip to London this past summer. Really crispy batter and flaky fish. Despite being deep fried, didn't feel oily at all. Tartar sauce, salt and vinegar, are complimentary. Curry sauce is a £1 extra and most sides are £1.5/5 for the cod lunch deal, halibut filet, and chicken mushroom pie. 5/5 for the unbeatable price. Around £5 for a huge slab of fish with chips. Pies were around £2.5/5 for the super friendly service. Chatted with the owner and he recommended the pie.3/5 for the location. It's a little out of the way unless you happen to be in this part of town. Despite the location, it was worth the extra 15 minutes of walking to get here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Curry sauce for the fish
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Huge order of the cod and chips lunch special
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Chicken mushroom pie - recommended by owner.

O6LFmnl-hUk4yhfH-Tf-UQ.text: Just popped in tonight after seeing good things from this place online and after not finding many fish and chip shops in central London. AWESOME! Fish was super fresh-huge-n fried to perfection, chips were delicious. The staff were genuinely friendly and accommodating too. Great experience!

O3r0odYB9p1BEuMNgAx4vA.text: Enjoyed my first English Fish and Chips. We trusted Yelp and were totally satisfied. The fish was light and very fresh. The fries were cooked well. Great atmosphere and a fantastic example of a small restaurant serving great food

JXcF1NDccLaF9XAaO3-12g.text: I personally think its the best in town, though the seating leaves much to be desired.Can't say much more but I'd love some fish and chips this weekend - too bad my abusive wife doesn't like it (abusive in that she prevents me from eating fish and chips more regularly, also she hits me).

hJkQZyeuvm5eDat9n7uvew.text: This place though not easy to find was worth the hunt!! Delicious fish and chips and great service!! Could even byob!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Pickled gherkin

_3g4nOMarLHxMQHDryOYNw.text: Best fish and chips I have ever had in London. Worth visiting and its super delicious.

QgSRZ0m4K-ZuPwcuxOAcPg.text: Totally solid fish & chips, along with down to Earth friendly service. A bit in a residential area, but worth the trip for exemplary fish & chips!

v-segcEzhlfLj-8uKfguXA.text: Hadn't been to London in quite some time and wanted some genuine English fish and chips.  Highest rated place was Bailey's so off I went. I had the lunch special Fish and Chips and added mushy peas and gravy. The fish serving was delicious and generous size. The gravy was very good.  The chips and the peas-average.The staff was very pleasant.  The best aspect of Bailey's is that where so many chippys heat up already cooked fish, Bailey's cooks their fish as it is ordered.

KlV09ZUw10fqHr93mYzSBQ.text: Hot food, fresh fish, great deal. Awesome customer service.My first London Fish and Chips experience and it was terrific .Staff explains the different fish and taste in case non locals like me aren't sure.

GzmtJDDwGdaP66F8kC0FEw.text: We were visiting from California and found this place close to where we were staying in London and found the staff to be extremely friendly and the food to be delicious. Absolutely loved the cod and chips!Highly recommend checking this place out.

8jo5-O62foB3XGu8eTRe1A.text: Best Fish and Chips I've had in London so far. By a long shot. Friendly and fast service, too.

XKI2lAB9IkoVUCAP2FSeZw.text: I'm an American.  If you're using a US credit card, you'll pay an extra fee.  The meal is still cheap compared with the amount of food that they serve you.  Big and generous portions.  Fish was crispy and tasty.  The fries are bigger steak fries.  About a quarter of them were crispy (I requested for them to be cooked extra crispy) - these fries are harder to get crispy because of the size.

qJVERqhIK1emZW_Bo-7Bcw.text: Great fish and chips! Large portions for a cheap price. Well worth the money, but it seemed like a really nice place to go with another person, but when you go with a small group, there is not enough room because of the size of the shop. Though it was great service from all of the employees.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Normal fish and chips with sparkling water.

OmEAQIReldAhZgBYgkcuqA.text: Food: great !Price: correct. Staff: really friendly. Would I go again ? For sure !!! If you're in the mood for fish and chips. This is the place to be !!

ypF0COvWbaenGrSzI8Cp5Q.text: Blimey!  My piece of cod was huge.You know what to do.....tell em Josh sent you.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. The best fish & chips.

9XemevRygCNCTelZqHf8SQ.text: Prepare to be mind blown. It's a tiny place, and worth the walk and it won't break the bank either. They do have quite a few other items on the menu, but why mess with perfection? Outstanding, obviously homemade tartar sauce, with Sarson's Malt Vinegar and a giant lemon on top of some fried cod, with golden yellow chips makes a ginormous meal for one and realistically a perfect meal for a couple. From 12-5 weekdays they take £1 off as a lunch special too!Staff was friendly, and for a tiny place, it has lots of bar seating, a few seats even looking right out the storefront into the neighborhood. Worth a visit for anyone in London who wants the best form of the classic dish, and a reasonably short walk to and from the tube to grind a few of the calories off.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Best of Breed, no questions worth the visit!

3Vvc1UR47cy0vqDrP4Dn2A.text: Straight off the plane and all we wanted was fish and chips. This was our first stop. The fish was sitting in the warming window and was reheated for us and not fresh.  The fries were extra stale and hard.  I'm not sure if this is how traditional Fish and chips tastes but so far I think it's better in the United States made by Korean guys.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

IDa2IkyAltwqcUQzTJ2usw.text: Went to Bailey's for fish and chips with family. We received a warm reception by the employees. Adam was very friendly and informative, very good hospitality.Large portions, prepared fresh to order. The Cole slaw was home made and very good. The food was very reasonably priced.A small quaint Resturant with counter seating for about 14 people. I rarely write reviews, so that fact that I took the time to write this should be an indication that visiting this Resturant is worth your time and effort.

Ehl-bUUYrpCiM6YGOy4kag.text: Fish 'n chips was on my mind, and this place delivered in spades. A selection of several kinds of fish, more than just one or two good choices of sides, and some other little things including delectable ice cream in interesting flavors to round out the whole. The proprietor was super genial, informative, and just a pleasant person to be around. He inquired a bit as to us and our circumstances (obviously foreign to the UK), but checked up on us to ensure we were still happy during our dine-in experience. Small place, so most were taking out, but definitely worth a visit. Staying on the list of places to pop in to, next time!

lKpMDv8tCowpZeiY1uACEQ.text: Best Fish and Chips in London! I took the enitre family today and had great dinner! The Restuarant is small, but don't let it fool you the food a great! The service matches the food. One of Fullham's/London's Finest! We well be here again soon!

ZexOpnQI94Ww3dhb4GhO5Q.text: The chicken nuggets are the bomb!! Really good food, really nice people!! I'm visiting from the states and my husband and I stopped here for authentic fish and chips. I'm so glad we did! The portions are large, and so is the flavor. We ordered both the cod and chips and the haddock and chips to go. And the chicken nuggets and the garlic mushrooms... we got so much food!  And such good food. I loved every thing! The fish was tender and crunchy. The chips were crispy, even after we walked 10 minutes back to the hotel. We ate the chicken nuggets in the shop while the other food cooked, and they were perfect. Being from the US were you can get fried chicken everywhere (pretty much!) I wasn't expecting to be impressed. But I was, they were great!! Very very happy with this place!

Fir1rmvi12YDCwQzdtnWIQ.text: I used to live in Ravenscourt Park and my roommate and I would take the bus to get to this place and enjoy a nice chat and fish and chips. This place is hands down the best fish and chips I've had in the U.K. The portions are a good size for the price you pay and the food is always hot and fresh. I especially love the fact that the skin is still on the fish which elevates fish and chips to a whole new level. This place is so lovely and I can't wait to come back to London so I can have more!

bVRUV6cF_qCKJeq2B0RATw.text: We were out one evening and wanted fish & chips for dinner and this place was reasonably close to where we were and was only a little off the direct path back to our hotel. The reviews said the portions were huge and the prices were reasonable, so we thought we would try it.When we arrived, there was not a seat available in the place, which suggested it was popular. As busy as it was, service was prompt, and the reviews about portions being huge and prices were good were accurate.Oh yeah, and the food itself was great!

-veosqccFPGWNoNB7lcFqA.text: My husband and I are visiting from NYC and came here tonight after seeing the great reviews on yelp. On this Sunday night I noticed a steady stream of people that kept pouring in. Everything was fresh, homemade, and delicious. We ordered the deep fried sausage, chicken and mushroom pie, cole slaw, chicken nuggets, and a small order of fish and chips. Deep fried sausage came with a lemon garlic aioli that was very fresh, light, and paired great with all the food. Please don't leave without trying the aioli. The chicken and mushroom pie was really flavorful. The chicken nuggets are really special and a must try. They are fried in a seasoned batter and are not your typical fast food nuggets. They are real pieces of super juicy chicken in a crispy batter. The fish and chips are great. We both ordered a small, but the portion was very very big. The fish, chips, and nuggets were fried upon ordering, and not sitting around. The man who takes orders gave great recommendations, and was very friendly. Baileys is good fresh food done right.

Tj1Itq1JyIKAw08Ckf14Uw.text: Waiting 3 days into my trip to try this place and it did not disappoint. The best fish and chips I have ever had. The portions are huge and the price is half of what I've been paying at other pubs. It's a small place and the ventilation is not very good, but the food makes up for it.  The staff was great.  Overall,  I will go back on my next trip to London ,whenever that will be.

kA2aQTJfX5kTN37lQ2YQbw.text: First time to London got to get fish and chips.. 4of us hungry after getting off Eurostar from Paris .. cod , cod roe , salmon cake , chips , rings, beef onion pie .... all pretty good ... nice clean little place.. where the locals go!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

8DCe4aQ1R1UrjEQUt4E4Pw.text: Best value fish and chips in and around London. Staff is friendly and food is cooked to order. Definitely a stop

Ch8m5x6EZAGMjbQNq3QNEQ.text: Been to London a few times now. Always have some fish and chips because ... you know ... it's London. Thought it was alright, but nothing to write home about, but Bailey's?? Damn that was good. Place was a bit out of the way, but worth the trip. Big portions of delicious fish, fresh and cooked to perfection, not overly oily like some other places. The best I've had so far.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Take my fish and I'll kill you. My last meal on death row? This fish.

wl39RsjRMdSrh8sBwyeHXw.text: Tasty food. The quality of the fish was pretty good compared to the ones I can find in my local area. Everybody I went with enjoyed the food. If you are ever visiting London, definitely give this place a try!

s1juLeRsoMqkMg9NoQQwcQ.text: Was visiting from out of town for work and Bailey's was recommended by a local we work with. Cod and chips was lovely and the service was amazing! They even offered us the wifi passcode as they could tell we were traveling. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Fulham!

8c9o6qXKu3XjpmnrRlOqYg.text: Super tasty, awesome prices, and definitely felt like I was getting an authentic London experience.  This place isn't near all of the super touristy spots.  My wife and I really loved eating here.  It takes a while to get there, but I thought it was worth it.  Enormous piece of fish, I love the batter, the fries(I'm American) were nice and thick.  Probably one of the most enjoyable meals we had in London.  Simple, no frills, and delicious.

lb6kqRVZTcFFq6rNLzyUOg.text: the best and freshest fish and chips i ever had!!!  and plenty of chips came here twice on my trip

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

Vy3pQFSkLwLS5nhI24qYaw.text: The wife and I ate here as our first stop during our trip to London. Based on the reviews from Yelp and TripAdvisor, we thought this would be a "can't miss". This place is a "miss" by a mile. We went during a weekday mid-afternoon (perfect as everyone is working, so no one there) and had he place nearly ourselves. We loved the quaint seating arrangements, especially by the window where you can view the randoms waiting for the bus. Staff was fantastic. The food.......Ok, I'm not quite sure if there's a salt shortage or a general seasoning supply issue, but the cod was the most tasteless piece of fish I've ever had. No amount of doctoring could get the fish close to being with taste. I mean I dumped enough vinegar and salt for 4 people on it and I think I ruined it before I could get any taste out of it. The batter was mostly greasy, so I just ate the meat as best I could. The chips were actually pretty good (I'm a potato head) although equally tasteless but salvageable with salt. I don't know, man...if this spot is rated high, is there any hope for the other spots? Are the reviewers paid shills? Are the reviewers taste zombies? Only our first day so the search continues...

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful presentation marred by complete tastelessness...

Qto4x6EzTBiGLbeuFrVasA.text: Very nice and simple. Good prices and generous portions. Very good service. Would definitely come back!

cMw2gygX7xkygxEWI905SQ.text: Best fish and chips in the 7 continents. Nothing else needs to be said. But they need more seating because it is really busy. Service is great very nice and prompt! On of the best restaurants I have ever been too!I know this is more than what needs to be said but it deserves to be a review rather than and tip! Cheers

DcesWHPF6AzqioLVF55PaA.text: This is the classic story of build a great business and people will come. I was told about this place from someone else and have gone on to tell loads of other people, and for good reason. This is the only place I'll come to for fish and chips in London. The food is excellent and the service is the most polite and generous around. They really want to make sure you have a great time.We got the classic cod, in large, which is huge. For sides were got chips, onion rings, mushy peas and coleslaw. There are staple foods, and all of them were top of their game. If you can eat in, I say do so because of the friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

ttPKXYX3RvwGMaWHOadUEw.text: Hands down one of the best fish and chips meal I've ever had. The staff is very friendly and the prices are more than reasonable. Next time i come back to London, I am definitely not leaving without stopping at this place. 10/10 recommend

lxEpeLExnpSj6bF3yt4dWA.text: Inexpensive, large portions of fish and chips. The order came hot and just fried (you can hear the sizzle of oil in the background.)I have to say, fish and chips in the UK taste just like fish and chips in the US, though maybe hotter since they are constantly being ordered and fried.A layer of medium thick, crispy batter coated the haddock I had. The haddock tasted slightly more flavorful than the cod (which was also softer in texture.) The chips were cut pretty thick, there was a bottle of malt vinegar to accompany.I found fish and chips to be a bit bland after several bites, it's mostly lots of white fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Haddock! It looks like a fish!
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. The menu.

01WrgKbCzDfyoSkgTCCNfw.text: We found out way to Bailey's because of the wonderful Yelp reviews, and it did not disappoint.    The staff was helpful and greeted us as soon as we walked into this cozy little restaurant.  This is mainly a take-away spot, but there are just enough small counter seating.  I had the calamari and Hubby had the HUGE fish and chips.  Both were wonderful and flavorful.  So very inexpensive for the amount of food.  It was well worth our adventure to find this gem.  There is an extra £1 charge to use a credit card, but the prices are so low that cash is a good option.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Bailey's calamari and chips with mushy peas (yum!)
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Bailey's fish and chips with slaw (yum!)

gcQfHZf-mwKX7mpqEMuG4g.text: Very friendly staff, affordable, and a good eat! Highly recommend for the real fish and chips experience

G-DquporFUljmbryiJtcJA.text: I was shocked to see the huge portion of fish - 3 large pieces of cod and a generous amount of chips. Hot and fresh although was a bit greasy by the time I got it home. Excellent value. The only thing that could be better is there is a thin layer of skin on the fish which could be removed prior to frying.The calamari was also quite tasty and has a different batter than the fish. It was flavourful and a good portion size for your money.The dining area is small as it's designed for takeaway so if you don't mind sitting by the window or near the fryers then order takeaway. Casual and clean, this is a decent spot for a variety of fish and chips.

fZa5p3Lj-WNfctjCR2UWEg.text: What I Ordered: Large cod fish and chips with a side of mashed peasFlavor: The best fish and chips I've ever eaten.  Batter was very flavorful.Service: The staff was very friendly.  The guy at the counter spotted my wife and I trying to take a selfie and offered to take the photo for us.Atmosphere: Old timey hole in the wall fish and chips place.Price: Very reasonable for the portion sizes you get and for London.Other Comments:  This was at the top of our priority list of places to try in London and did not disappoint.  It's not in the center of London, so be prepared for a bit of a pricey trip if you're taking a taxi or Uber to get there from the city center.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Large Cod

4aivN3MoNlrujU_w6hQTOw.text: We went here for lunch for the $6.50 lunch special which was absolutely massive. It was made fresh and was arguably the best fish n chips I've had in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. $6.50 Lunch Special

JRDcrge3X1kKaoZcKUfvkw.text: Service was great! Food was excellent and well priced. I ordered the cod and the chips and took a seat, my food was brought out to me. It comes with dip sauce. No alcohol available and I had to use an ATM machine located nearby to withdraw Linda since they weren't currently accepting credit cards from us. All in all it was a good meal and nicely priced and nice device!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

vZkoxt74g8KLJ2Tw2bkZsw.text: Best fish and chips I've ever had!! First thing we had when we arrived in London and it will always be a favorite of mine!

C9C4LJ_52xRDLnZVqDmS2Q.text: Popular restaurant for fish and chips!Friendly staff, wide variety of menu, free wifi!Most cozy place for a lunch!Chicken salad was really nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

PzCqF0hfNXBsXKNxH-kJGA.text: Fabulous fish . The chips are always undercooked though.  Ask them to cook a little longer. HUGE portions.

dXfKfoi_FJYllgFJ4VZkwA.text: During my recent and first trip to London, I was dying to try REAL fish and chips. I was asked by a great friend to hold off for a few days until our schedules aligned. At first, I didn't think that I would be able to wait that long. Man am I glad that I did. Everything was well worth the wait! The fish and chips meal was fantastic. I added the works! Delicious mushy peas, creamy remoulade, sharp malt vinegar and a touch of their curry sauce! I ordered the large, not knowing what I would be getting myself into and ALMOST tapped out but I hung in there and cleaned my plate. We even somehow managed to save room for dessert! The customer service was what impressed me. How you make someone feel during an experience like this one will last forever. As soon we entered, Adam greeted with a huge smile and a welcome. He as well as the rest of the team went out of their way to meet and exceed our expectations! I'd fly back just to go back to Baily's!

4eyughdnJIKRFXMjDWLeUQ.text: We went here after receiving a recommendation from friend who had come years ago. They told us to make our way there and we did. Boy, were they right. The food was amazing and we added the chicken nuggets, which were also excellent. The small cod was huge and way too much for us to finish, but we tried. Well worth a trip if you're even close. The servers were extremely courteous and fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

ybQtw84YNaqK0Z_ZMCYqfg.text: Recommended.  Of the 3 Fish-and-Chips restaurants we tried, this was 3rd best but still very good comparing to anything we get in California.

IHuPHj48NE1edQhqoIZopQ.text: The owner asked us as we walked in if we wanted to eat in or take away ( to go if you're not from Europe  ). He comes over and personally assists us in our selection. Helps with recommendations and the food is great !!! Chips are crisp and the pie was amazing I know we got pie at a fish and chips spot

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

VmcPnViA9-IN6DNUiQs3vw.text: If you do t like the fish and chips here, you simply don't like fish and chips! These are the best I ever had and was truly worth the trip off the beaten path from downtown London! Will indeed go back again!!

-nxysT_jypg7kCrg-D1dNQ.text: I had a fantastic experience here. Ordered the large cod and large chips. Huge serving of cod. Very fresh and crisp. The fish tasted very fresh and firm. The chips were plentiful. Hot and freshly made. Crisp with a soft center. Ketchup and tarter sauce are usually not free, but he gave them to us.  My wife and I filled up on just the one order as above. It is a little far from Westminster, but was well worth the trip. Best fish and chips during our stay in London.

No5O4uYa0YITXpY_IJjc5Q.text: I fell in love with this place and it's owners. Two very nice gentlemen who make a great fish and chips. The mushy peas was excellent. They give you so much food for a great price. I can't wait to go back on my next trip to London

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

nyTakQb8LDbLhl7wKBgfBA.text: Loved this place! The best fish and chips in London! ! Great selection of fish with huge portions and very reasonable cost. Chips and sides were good too with the usual condiments.Seating is limited, only about 12 spots to sit. Lots of people came in and out for take away.Staff is incredibly friendly and fun to talk with.It was a bit hot in the heat wave but I imagine the rest of the time it wouldn't be too bad.

ujaSzE6XEJTRjL4s9qetwA.text: I had never been to Londonbefore and wanted some authentic fish and chips, not the commercial stuff!!! I found it at Baileys. It's not a fine diner, but the most important thing, the food, was delicious. I had the cod and chips. I also had the Cumberland battered sausage. For less than 10 pounds it can easily be shared

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

3PGm1D7XXEBu5oHdI_m_Tw.text: I grew up in Kodiak Alaska and fished up there in my younger years so I am very picky about my fish.  With that being said this places serves some awesome fish. I ordered the large cod and it was huge and worth the money. I subbed mashed potatoes for the chips and if I lived nearby I would visit all the time.  It is a small place so you might have to wait for a seat or get it to go but you should visit this place if your looking for some great fish.

BVAbdvAOvI7HaWdmOkRMHw.text: By far the best quality fish and chips during my trip! They have excellent customer service. The fish was served hot and their chips are big! The restaurant wasn't super accessible, so we sat outside on the bench next to a bus stop. Thanks for a wonderful experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

GkOvODQRbogFG6qWWBmqVQ.text: Bailey's is a small place in London that serves some of the best fish and chips ever! The employees are cheerful and god to serve you. I ordered the cod and chips and ate inside. The seating area is rather small, but it is nice to eat there if you are in a small group of 3 or less. The fish has a crispy and flaky batter that is phenomenal! The fish is perfectly fried and goes great with their tartar sauce and some malt vinegar. The chips are fresh, crispy and delicious! I put some salt and malt vinegar on my chips and it was great with some ketchup. The atmosphere of Bailey's is great and their fish and chips are delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Cod and Chips
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Menu

oewe_FtEFpPs3w1BK5o_6A.text: Arrived in London and immediately felt a craving for fish and chips and mushy peas.  We walked about an hour from our hotel in Kensington to get here based on the Trip Advisor review.  It's a bit of a hole in the wall, not a lot of seating.  We sat at the counter.  We all ordered a large portion of the cod and chips.  It's Huge amount of food next time I'll go for the small portion so as not to waste food.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  I recommend the curry sauce for the fries.   The mushy peas were also delicious. The beer is Budweiser.  It doesn't taste any better in England...loved this place!

WTkePII2tA8MYa4-7L49TA.text: I don't know who Bailey is and why her fish and chips are SO DAMN GOOD, but I do know that I will be thanking her in my prayers everyday for having such a positive impact on my life. Seriously BESTTTTTT fish and chips I had in London, actually best fried fish I've had so far anywhere honestly. I was so excited to try this place after reading raving reviews online and it definitely did not disappoint. The fish was cooked to perfection and the chips were so fresh and crispy. Be sure to ask for the sweet chilly and spicy chilly sauce as they compliment both the fish and chips really well. The staff is also very sweet and welcoming. One of the staff members found out we were from America and the first thing he offered was the WiFi password...like umm can the customer service get any better????????? I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting London. 10/10. V good. Life changing.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Lunch special: Cod with chips

xIR1xhSG9QwY1bSIS6rM1g.text: Just WOW!  I've had fish and chips in the states many times, love them; but to be honest with my expectations being set in the US, I was afraid I would try the original fish and chips and be so accustomed to my "taste" of them that I would not like them in England.  I was way wrong!  These were not only great, but overall so much better than anything I could have imaginedThe fries...thick, with a crispy pop on the outside, smooth soft inside, just perfect, how fries should be.  Now I'm going to hate fries everywhere else I order them!The fish...I ordered a small Cod.  I can usually only eat small portions of deep fried foods.  This was absolutely perfect as well, crispy on the outside but moist thick fish in the inside.  In the US, the steam from the fish usually makes it soft in spots, not here.  Stayed crispy.The tartar sauce was a priority to me.  I love good somewhat sweet tartar, and this was dead perfect.  Lastly, I ordered the smashed pees too, again, a perfect side for the fish.I couldn't be happier, except that I couldn't finish it, and that anytime I try to order fish or chips anywhere after this, I will be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Love this cola
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Small fish and chips!!

JNs-kv7fRewxvzW8rhBe1Q.text: Came here around 5:20 pm on a Saturday and there were a lunch special going on! There were only a few customer and the service was excellent! We ordered the Cod and fish lunch special, and the Chicken and mushroom pie. The fish and chips were the best I've ever had in London!! My first fish and chips were from poppies in Camden market and it didn't impressed me at all. but this place does!!! It's so crispy and fresh! While we were there eating there were also lots of locals coming in to get take out!Seems to be a popular place!!! I'll  definitely miss its fish and chips and pie and will visit again when I'm in London!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Medium fries and cod
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and mushroom pie. Delicious!!

L2aXxKzOC8P3VV-vbDFg6w.text: I'll give it a go for my first London review of Bailey's Fish & Chips. There is no point for me to try and tell you which chip shop to go to but if you're near Chelsea and Fulham then make your way to this chip shop. The chips are so freakin good. Hot and crispy outside and fluffy inside. Quality continues with the cod fish fried to perfection. My favorite way to eat the chips was with a side of their aioli with hints of lemon and garlic. The cod was best with vinegar and plenty of salt (I don't have hypertension...yet ha). Though ketchup and tartar sauces are available at table side. I really enjoyed their fried calamari. It had a soft tender inside with a breadcrumb crust..yum with a couple of squeezes of lemon wedges. Thank you Baileys Fish and Chips for the perfect start to my trip. 4whisks

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

fdXEDIWA9ET9tASfuKeTZw.text: For a period of about 4 months in 2017, I lived a 5-minute walk away from this place, and my first ever meal in the U.K. was an order of fish n chips from here, so this place holds a special place in my heart. The staff are really friendly and the atmosphere is pretty cozy. It's a small space, so seating can get a bit cramped, especially since it's pretty popular and busy every day. You get a pretty generous amount of food for the price; I felt this was one of the cheapest places in London that I actually enjoyed getting food from.The food appears to be largely made to order, so there is a bit of a wait. The savory pies appear to be ready to go. A small cod and chips is plenty of food for 1 person; you could probably even split the chips. I also tried the pineapple fritters, which were so tasty and definitely a great treat.Note that they charge extra for non-British bank cards. The shop is a 15-minute walk from the Fulham Broadway tube station.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and mushroom pie (takeaway)
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Inside

x4rpIt5GBZvIPmGfOC-xXg.text: Just had fish and chips from the source! This place is sooo good I enjoyed every bite. My boyfriend and I came all the way from New York to see Chelsea and enjoy some fish and chips after. We had Haddock and chips with calamari. We enjoyed every bite.... we had hot chilli and sweet chilli The SWEET CHILLI was Zee best! It tastes good with anything! We had two sodas sat and ate and they served us well. The coleslaw was ehhhh but everything else was perfect. Make sure you make this stop after the game.... and thank me later

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

PFp9DkzAsoS1DAeIpsUDGg.text: It doesn't matter that Bailey's is in Fulham and could be far away from you. Jump the Piccadilly line and follow it all the way out; you won't regret it. To me, this is best fish and chips in the LAND. Well, the chips are just okay (if they were Belgian style frites, tho) You get a huge chunk of moist fish, flaky flavorful crust. The vinegar here is tasty too. Don't forget to order a vat of curry for your fries! The folks working here are really nice! Worth the trek for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Menu (don't forget the curry for your chips!)
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Outstanding fish!

IzJIxKgLpS6W885_54g-BA.text: My friend and I made a special trip here in February while in London for two days. We read the reviews on trip advisor and this place did not disappoint! Alex was definitely helpful in picking out selections and the proper way to eat fish and chips. Very friendly staff, we talked a lot about California. Luckily we got in there before the local soccer game ended cause it was getting packed as we were finishing up. I hope to swing by this place again when we make it back to London!

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom

LXFqhcITje_ptdq1iw3jzA.text: Best fish and chips ever! Large is a huge piece of cod ~12" long. Chips crispy on outside, fluffy and moist inside.Great tartar sauce. Cole slaw is very creamy, but crispy cabbage and carrot-terrific flavor and texture. Friendly service; we arrived shortly before closing but they happily accommodated us.

t_oYm43tsW3T24HdWQnqgg.text: One of my favorite meals in London. Wanted to a local "chippy" vs. the typical line out the door type of places and found this place. The fish and chips were very very tasty. They only had a couple options for drinks but they were great! The staff was super nice which helped as well. Great food, great experience.

1QHrsjZHieKkLBt2n0UrRQ.text: Last night in London. It was time. Fish and chips. We were fortunate enough to be around the corner from the lovely Bailey's and I can't speak highly enough of this little shop. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating and the famed cod was about as delicious as I imagine fried fish can be. We got a spot in the window bar area and watched as a plethora of different customers came in and out while we ate. I honestly couldn't tell whether they'd been in a thousand times or if it was their first visit; the service was really that good.The prices are good, the owners are lovely, and the food is great whether you're fresh off the plane or five beers in. If you're visiting London, this is the best authentic experience you can get.

HuMZDR0pLupqBKLXGG7uxg.text: First of all there was a little misunderstanding about miles and kilometres. Result was-we walked 5 km instead of 2,6 from our hotel. But. It was totally worth to walk. Portions-huge. HUGE!!! Fish was sooooo good... There are only 10 places at the tables but I highly recommend to wait in line or take fish&chips take-away. Our meal (for 5 person) consisted of 5 portions of fish&chips (cod and haddock), one sparkling water and 2 bottles of lemonade. Total bill was 43£. Not bad. Not at all. We couldn't finish our portions (a little bit too much) so 5 km back to hotel was exactly what was needed. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Portion of fish&chips. Haddock. Huge meal.

qWAMAKrr1dsTqekgQnMPFA.text: Really good food and fantastic service at a great price. The restaurant is a bit of a dive, with only about 12 seats total. I would definitely get fish and chips here again. No air conditioning means it's warm inside, so would recommend carrying out.

photos.caption: Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bailey's Fish and Chips - London, United Kingdom. Menus on the wall. Very limited seating.

3HyxZRwpi2cyYfASKyq4AQ.text: By far the best Fish & Chips on our visit. Staff was friendly and helpful and my kids loved the chicken nuggets.

jrT1oAcBEAA_A_p5nhxmFA.text: Very nice hole in the wall restaurant. You can order to go or eat in, they do have a limited seating area. I ordered the medium cod, chips and a drink and it was more than enough food for one person all for under £8. The fish was perfectly flaky, the outside was so light and crispy, and the chips were nice and hot. I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for an affordable great British fish 'n chips experience. They do have a lunch special from 12 - 5pm

W_bMgtmS4wRVZXBn9p5w7w.text: We ordered many items from the menu and all were either very good or superb.  The cod was succulent under the crispy shell of batter and the winner winner!  We tried all 3 fish cakes; cod, smoked haddock and salmon and dill which were all good.  For veggies we had lots of delicious chips, coleslaw, veggie spring roll and mushy peas.  Pineapple Fritters with honey was dessert.Service was kind, wonderful and helpful.

WYBAaUuw_1U4ZBGFMkODTA.text: During my visit to London, I wanted to try the best fish and chips in town. As I was staying near Earl's Court, I was looking for something near by. After some research came to know about this place called Bailey's. That time Bailey's had 5 reviews and 5 star. So I was very skeptical about this place. But took my chance, headed over to this place. When I reached the place, my first impression of this place was not very good, very very small. But amount pick-up orders were pouring in, encouraged me to enter the place. surprise surprise, there is no table, they have this wall mounted sections, where you can keep your food and eat. I ordered one Cod and one Haddock and right away every one started to give me a look. That time I had no idea what I was getting into. After few minutes of wait, I was served my most memorable fish and chips of my life. Fishes were humongous. I was very very hungry, so I fished the food withe ease. Delicious, delicious and delicious. Not getting intimidated by the looks of place and going in was worth it. If you are anywhere near Fulham and Chelsea, just visit this place.

O5qagqZb4gL8JJZsLtHPFg.text: Classic neighborhood Fish and Chips. Very small, only 10 seats, so you usually have to wait for a seat. Tight quarters. Large serving of F&C enough for 2 people and was very good. Onion rings very good. Cole slaw was good. Staff very friendly and efficient

do-T7KE-q6UWyKce5NKVbw.text: Very nice local spot. The cod and chips lunch special is a great deal and huge. Everything is made fresh. Also the ice cream pints offered are really yummy my favorite is the vanilla bean. Owners are super friendly great service. A must try. The restaurants gets a bit hot as it is small and no air con.

qSq_8YH8EJELsG-Hj7zv7Q.text: Cute little 15 (ish) seat restaurant. Fish was awesome:  batter was light and crispy, fish was fresh. A great find for a quick, delicious meal. Also notable.... Might just be your cheapest meal in London. Fab value!!!

2PZZvcCDRcrP87YfzT3Kig.text: The best Fish & Chips in London!  Glad I stopped by on trip from the states.  The staff was friendly and the fish is freshly prepared in front of you.  I had the Haddock. Once you've tasted Bailey's Fish & Chips anything you've had stateside no longer counts.  Will be back!

FKvdx7v-Ru-l_ftReBgBsw.text: I have made it my life's mission to find the best chip shop in England, and I plan a visit here the first day after landing, and the last day before going home. It is everything a good chip shop should be, and while I probably have not found the best chip shop in the whole country, I'm pretty sure it's the best one in London. Be prepared for a lengthy queue, it is a small place!

CiapxXaP2NB2J280LBebtw.text: #11 out of 16,000+ restaurants in London!  That is quite an endorsement in and of itself!   Son had calamari and chips while I had the standard cod (fish & chips).    The portions were generous and perfectly fried.   Highly recommend!    They don't serve alcohol but will gladly let you grab a beer at the convenience store next door to enjoy on their premises.    Service was outstanding even though it was standing room only (The Chelsea game had just let out.)   Perfect post game stop on the way home!

kYHIUDHRf2FcMpw-smnWuQ.text: Quite oily and by far not the best fish and chips shop in the area

hSGYxIJMBsk87uHRRfPlhw.text: Food is OK. Staff is racist and they forget a lot. I told I wanted water and they gave me tea. The waitor called me the n word and it's very offensive. When this place learns manners, I'll be back!! The steak wasn't bad though.

DmfmDLg16EoT2L40dG-ivQ.text: Came because of the yelp reviews and were not disappointed. Fish was perfect and staff was super nice. When you walk in and the local police are eating there, you know it's going to be good. 5-10 minute walk from the Fulham Broadway Tube station.

f3H93lFNqQaHO-Jxqj1lzA.text: We are in London on holiday, and wanted to try out a good valued Fish-and-Chips this evening.  We arrived about 1845 or so, and was surprised at how small the shop was, but we were seated promptly.  Our order took a bit longer to come up, and the place was quite busy on this Friday night.   A few minutes after we sat down a queue formed outside, and it was warp 9 in the kitchen with folks in a cooking frenzy to get out food.  Our fish was excellent - we tried Haddock and Cod, and our salmon fish cake was descent.  The chips were nice and hot, but just average, so overall we were pleased with our experience.  The price was certainly  reasonable as well.

lHF8NHqekdCoHbxNqv312A.text: Perfectly fried fish enshrouded in beautifully crisp exterior, huge portions, great prices, and incredibly welcoming staff; I don't think one can ask for much more of a restaurant. I had cod and chips and it was brilliant! Eat here and you will feel like a local and maybe even start speaking with an accent!
